response.overview: In 1941, Maria Harkavenko, a resident of the village of Parishkiv, Kyiv region, was taken to Germany for forced labor. She joined the ranks of the so-called Ostarbeiters and, with tears and sweat, wrote herself into a shameful page of human history, which will go down in textbooks under the title "Modern Slavery."
response.title: НепрOstі листи
